Control Name: INCIDENT HANDLING | CORRELATION WITH EXTERNAL ORGANIZATIONS
Control Statement: The organization coordinates with [Assignment: organization-defined external organizations] to correlate and share [Assignment: organization-defined incident information] to achieve a cross- organization perspective on incident awareness and more effective incident responses.Supplemental Guidance:  The coordination of incident information with external organizations including, for example, mission/business partners, military/coalition partners, customers, and multitiered developers, can provide significant benefits. Cross-organizational coordination with respect to incident handling can serve as an important risk management capability. This capability allows organizations to leverage critical information from a variety of sources to effectively respond to information security-related incidents potentially affecting the organizationâ€™s operations, assets, and individuals.

control_attributes.SelectionParam: IR-4 (8) [external organizations including consumer incident responders and network defenders and the appropriate CIRT/CERT (such as US-CERT, DOD CERT, IC CERT)]
